User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

Currently to get the most out of enabling configurable security policies, it is necessary to specify domain names that will be acted on. So if I want to block javascript from all sites except for all the servers in the acme.com domain, I have to specify which servers are in the exceptiong (ie. sub1.acme.com, sub2.acme.com, sub3.acme.com, etc.).

It would be better, to allow a wildcard and be able to implicitly enable all subdomains to a parent domain, without having to specify each and every subdomain. 

Reproducible: Always
